results.description: We gaan het binnenkort oc070.nl noemen, dat staat dan voor ondernemerscafé Den Haag. En zeker ook voor open coffee. 6 januari 2016 de eerste van het nieuwe jaar. Klaas Punselie doet een mini masterclass start-up business modelling. Dit is je begin van een nieuw jaar ondernemerschap. Graag tot woensdag 6 januari 9:00-11:00 uur.
results.name: OpenCoffee Den Haag - oc070 Monthly Meetup

results.description:
In January we will host "Security for developers" meetup.

Speaker: Michael Boelen

Michael specializes in the field of Linux/Unix security. In the last years, he worked as a consultant for several international companies, including T-Systems, Philips, and ASML. In 2013, he founded security firm CISOfy, to support companies with their auditing, hardening and compliance needs. 

Michael is the author of several open source security tools, like Rootkit Hunter and Lynis. Both are used in the toolkit of many system administrators and security professionals. Other work includes supporting the CIS benchmarks, and writing articles for the Linux Audit blog, covering Linux/Unix security.

He recently gave a talk at Blackhat USA and Blackhat Europe
results.name: Security for Developers

results.description:
Schedule 

• 18:00 - 19:00: Doors open, food & drinks

• 19:00 - 21:00: Program:

- Het bedrijf Elastic

- ELK stack 

- Plugins: shield, watcher and marvel

- Use Cases

- What is new in 2.0

Speakers: <a href="https://nl.linkedin.com/in/jettro"></a>Jettro Coenradie en Sander van Prooijen
results.name: Elastic: An Introduction to the ELK stack

results.description:
Zo'n 25 eerste jaars studenten hebben de afgelopen weken gewerkt aan hun eigen eindproject: creëer een eigen UX portfolio-website.

Doelstelling is dat ze hiermee een eerste prototype om zich in het tweede jaar hiermee te kunnen onderscheiden bij het zoeken naar een stage.

 Ze hebben onderzoek gedaan naar zichzelf, de doelgroep en concurrenten. Van hieruit hebben ze een conceptfase doorlopen om op zoek te gaan naar een uniek concept wat bij hun past. Vervolgens hebben ze gewerkt aan content, design, testen en zijn ze nu aan het einde van de periode druk bezig met het realiseren van hun prototype in HTML/CSS.

Daarom organiseren we nu een hackaton waarbij studenten, docenten en jullie UX-pro's elkaar gaan inspireren, helpen, feedback geven én hacken, en daarnaast vooral een plezierige avond beleven.
results.name: UX Portfolios Hackathon: design en prototype your portfolio

group.name: CMD Den Haag Interaction Design Meetup - Haagse Hogeschool

results.description:
A new year, a new meetup!

This months' talks will be about planning: your next trip to the snow or the best way to get to any place in the Netherlands.

• Maurice Mommen from wePowder, the online platform which serves the Dutch freeriding (i.e. skiing and snowboarding) community. Maurice will walk us through some of the technological and business challenges of building and running the platform which is unique of its kind. If we're lucky, he will also bring free stickers!

• Joost Cassee from GoAbout, the travel planner which gets you to where you need to be. What does it take to build a travel planner? How to deal with competition from the almighty Google? Why do we need another planner if we already have 9292? Joost will blow us away with his introduction to their paradigm-shifting planning platform... if not, there will always be the opportunity to meet new people while enjoying drinks and snacks!

• You here? We are still looking for interesting speakers, sponsors and location so get in touch if you'd like to help us out. Also for the next meetup which we have tentatively planned for March 25th. The meetup in January is supported by our main sponsor BeDataDriven and kindly hosted by eBrella at the Caballero Fabriek in Den Haag.

Hope to see you on the 29th!

Maarten-Jan and the /dev/haag crew.
results.name: /dev/haag meetup #33

results.description:
Schedule 

• 18:00 - 19:00: Doors open, food & drinks

• 19:00 - 21:00: In-memory computing with Akka, Spark, Solr and Cassandra (English)

Speaker: Natalino Busa

Bio: 

Natalino is currently Senior Data Architect at ING in the Netherlands, where he leads the strategy, definition, design and implementation of big/fast data solutions for data-driven applications, for personalized marketing, predictive analytics, and fraud/security management.

All-round Software Architect, Data Technologist, Innovator, with 15+ years experience in research, development and management of distributed architectures and scalable services and applications.

Served as Senior researcher at Philips Research Laboratories in the Netherlands, on the topics of system-on-a-chip architectures, distributed computing and parallelizing compilers.

Blogs regularly about big data, analytics, data science and scala reactive programming at natalinobusa.com

Here is a prep from Natalino for this meetup: https://www.oreilly.com/ideas/clustering-geolocated-data-using-spark-and-dbscan
results.name: In-memory computing with Akka, Spark, Solr and Cassandra

results.description:
Het is inmiddels februari. De goede voornemens om het dit jaar anders te gaan zijn..... gerealiseerd / in uitvoering / aangepast / vergeten / verdampt / omgezet in samenwerkingen / verzilverd /  ..... . 

Hoog tijd om dat met elkaar te delen. Een eerste balans om te maken en je verhaal weer even aan te scherpen. Kom feedback halen en geven. Ga weg met een concrete actie voor de komende maand. 

Je bent van harte welkom en... neem vooral iemand mee. 

Bij oc070 gaat het om kwantiteit en kwaliteit. De grootste en gezelligste open coffee van NL creeert ook nog eens de grootste toegevoegde waarde, dankzij... jou. 

Graag tot woensdag 3 februari 9:00 uur in het Ondernemerscafé.

results.description:
Op woensdag 2 maart 2016 gaat de open coffee over dromen en de realisatie hiervan. Drie ondernemers komen vertellen over de droom (onderneming) die zij afgelopen jaar hebben gerealiseerd. 

Corinne Hamoen schreef en publiceerde zelf haar sprookjes kookboek: Roos en Kris 

Azer Khan zette samen Juriaan Houdijk (hier in Bink36) de eerste fashion drukkerij van Nederland: The Oven.

Willy Mooren droomde een jaar geleden over een eigen gin.... En die is er nu: Hermit - Dutch Coastal Gin. 

En dan uiteraard de vraag naar jouw droom(onderneming) wat staat er op jouw 'wishlist'? Wij gaan tijdens de open coffee onze uiterste best doen om vanuit de lessen, ervaringen, gemaakte fouten en behaalde successen van bovenstaande ondernemers jou een stap te laten zetten bij de realisatie van jouw droom(onderneming). 

Graag tot woensdag 2 maart. Deur open: 9:00 uur, plenair gedeelte 9:45-10:15. 

------------------

Als je toch komt, of niet kunt, wil je de link oc070.nl of onderstaande uitnodiging delen via LinkedIn? Of de uitnodiging op FB liken/sharen?

https://www.facebook.com/hetondernemerscafe/photos/a.556784234470710.1073741828.551115738370893/589645341184599/?type=3&theater
results.name: OpenCoffee Den Haag - oc070 Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Abstract:The way we develop, deploy and manage software is rapidly changing. Innovations like continuous delivery, containers and microservices confront us with new challenges and complexities. In this session Olaf Molenveld, CEO and co-founder of Magnetic.io,  will show us Vamp (www.vamp.io). An open source platform that aims to take the pain out of deploying, testing and managing (micro)service and container-based architectures with a strong focus on Canary-testing&releasing and microscaling. This interactive session will include a live demo of Vamp.

About Olaf Molenveld (CEO & co-founder of Magnetic.io)
Olaf has over 15 years of experience in the internet industry in various technical, architecture and managerial roles. With a background as a software developer, Olaf is in a unique position to assess business concerns versus technical solutions.


In his former life, Olaf has built a marketing-oriented internet agency with a strong technical focus, and was technical consultant and strategic director of development at Mirabeau. In this role he was helping teams designing innovative online solutions and e-commerce focused architectures for companies like Transavia, Landal Greenparks and G-Star.
In his role of CEO @ Magnetic.io he is focusing on product-market fit, business-development, and of course making sure there are always enough resources to keep the company and team running and happy ;)

18:00 Doors open

18:15 Dinner - Pizza time!

19:00 Session starts

21:00 We end the session

This meetup is hosted by
results.name: VAMP - Very Awesome Microservices Platform

results.description:
Because of Good Friday, we are moving the March meetup one week ahead. On Friday March 18th, we will be back in Nomadz with the following speakers:

• Matthijs Kamstra will introduce us to Haxe, a programming language with which you can target a whole range of platforms. This will be a gentle introduction to the Haxe toolkit: what is it? What can you use it for? What problems does it solve?

• Alex Bertram will tell us about ActivityInfo and what it takes to run a Software-as-a-Service product with thousands of users around the world. It turns out that it takes a little more than setting up a box in the corner with a server on it...

• Vincent Holleman will pitch the Impact Economy program at the gemeente Den Haag.

Get in touch if you want to sponsor the drinks and snacks.

Hope to see you on the 18th!

Maarten-Jan and the /dev/haag crew.

P.S. this meetup has limited space so sign up quickly or add yourself to the waitlist.
results.name: /dev/haag meetup #34

results.name: OpenBorrel Den Haag - monthly meetup

results.description:
THANK YOU FOR READING THIS ENTIRE MESSAGE CAREFULLY :). 

Many starting enterpreneurs start out investing a lot of time and energy into their baby (in 4HWW terms: their muze): their new business idea, in the hopes of gaining financial freedom.

However most new ideas fail. 

How beautiful would life be if you could follow a process that enables you to try out your new idea without all these upfront investments?  

Indeed. 

It does exist, and the process / philosophy is called "The Lean Startup." 

This meeting we're going to present you a real life case study from a business that does this continuously. 

This guy "lean startups" every idea he has, and build a thriving (200K+) business in several niches you probably never heard of. 

He does this "4HWW-style", outsourcing everything he can strategically and drastically. 

In this  workshop you will gain a working knowledge of both concepts: the 4 Hour Work Week, ánd the Lean Startup. 

Apply it to your own business ideas without ever losing another dime unnecessarily - and grow your business much faster. 

Cost are 15 E. Sign-up using this link: https://paypro.nl/product/4HWW_workshop/31502. You will receive the exact details about the location - somewhere in Amsterdam - a week before the event. 

Only 30 spots (first come, first serve - sold out last time.) 

(This is promoted in our Facebook group as well, and will not be recorded.) 

(You can ONLY enter if you made the online payment, i.e. NO ENTRY by cash payment at the door!)
results.name: Case Study: How I Created Multiple 4HWW Businesses And How U Can Too, Risk Free

Er kan ook weer 10 x 30 seconden gepitcht worden voor je zelf, je onderneming, een vraag of een advies. Hier hangt vanaf april een prijskaartje aan van € 4,95 (excl. BTW). 

Graag tot 6 april.

de gasten in april:

results.description:
Sprekers: Henk, Bas en Tobias (NL/NL/EN)

Progamma:

18:00 Entree

18:15 Eten- buffet!

19:00 Sessie start

pauze - 5 a 10 minuten

21:00 Officieel einde, borrelen

Henk van Cann gaat met toehoorders gepassioneerd in op het 'wat', het 'hoe', maar vooral het 'waarom' de toevallige uitvinding blockchain (onder de bitcoin). Deze grote belofte kan talloze aspecten van leven op aarde verbeteren. Henk geeft een inzichtelijke introductie over hoe blockchains werken en wat het voor je kan betekenen. Het is een interactieve sessie. De markt voor blockchain toepassingen ligt op dit moment open.

Bas Wisselink zal enkele voorbeelden geven van andere toepassingen dan alleen geld. Bas zal een korte inleiding NXT doen, de op Java gebaseerde blockchain, een overview van alle mogelijkheden (Currency, Assets, Voting, Data Cloud) binnen de NXT client. Tobias Schwarz uit Berlijn (Engels):

Tobias Schwarz is 27 jaar en maakt en werkt in de NXT community mee aan 3rd party systemen als: http://nxtpeers.com/examples.php

mynxt.info, de block explorer, hij heeft de UI gemaakt Een client gemaakt mét lite wallet systeem: http://tosch110.github.io/SuperNET-Lite-3/

: SuperNET Lite is an innovative Blockchain Lite Client concept. Using public nodes in the p2p network it can be used to monitor holdings of several crypto currencies and other tools. Tobias beantwoordt graag vragen over de simpele - en direct toegankelijke mogelijkheden van coding for Nxt. Mogelijk dat je door zijn verhaal (van turbulente ontwikkeling op jonge leeftijd) geinspireerd raakt om zelf eens te gaan rond kijken in deze Java blockchain.

This meetup is hosted by
results.name: Blockchain technologie

results.description:
*** English below ***

De 1e Meetup van de Den Haag UX Meetup group is direct een knaller. Jeff Gothelf, auteur van Lean UX. Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience is in Nederland op vakantie en is akkoord gegaan om speciaal voor ons Nederlandse UXies tijdens zijn vakantie een presentatie geven.

De Meetup is gratis toegankelijk maar we zouden het op prijs stellen als aanwezigen het nieuwe boek van Jeff (Sense and Respond: How Successful Organizations Listen to Customers and Create New Products Continuously) - wat je natuurlijk toch al wilde bestellen ;) - alvast bestelt op Amazon ($ 26).

De Meetup zal gehouden worden op het hoofdkantoor van ANWB in Den Haag (adres en routebeschrijving). Inloop is vanaf 19:00 en om 19:30 zal Jeff beginnen.

Er zijn 100 plekken beschikbaar. Als er geen plekken meer zijn geef je dan nog wel op voor de wachtlijst. Vaak komen er op het laatste moment weer een hoop vrij.

Verder
Dit is de eerste Haagse UX Meetup maar wat mij betreft niet de laatste. Heb je ideeën voor een presentatie of locatie of heb je een vacature die je onder de aandacht wil brengen die de 27e juli? Laat het weten.

*** English ***

This is the first Meetup of The Hague UX and directly this is going to be memorable. Jeff Gothelf, author of Lean UX, Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience is on holiday in the Netherlands and has agreed to give a presentation especially for us Dutch UXies during his vacation!

The Meetup is free of charge but we would really appreciate if attendees would RSVP and pre-order Jeffs new book, which you already wanted to buy of course. (Sense and Respond: How Successful Organizations Listen to Customers and Create New Products Continuously, $ 26 on Amazon).

The Meetup will be held at ANWB headquarters in The Hague (address and map). Walk-in is from 19:00. Around 19:30 Jeff will begin his presentation.

There are 100 places available. If there's no place left write down your name on the waiting list. Very often there will be spots available at the last minute or days.

More
This is the first The Hague UX Meetup but hopefully not the last. Do you have ideas for a presentation or location, or you have a vacancy that you want to announce, please let me know.
results.name: #1: Presentatie door Jeff Gothelf. Auteur van Lean UX

results.description:
Speaker: Niels van Eijck

Description: The Agile and DevOps software development lifecycles present interesting challenges for (Java) web application security. How can security keep up with the rapid development cycles, constantly changing codebase, and continuous deployment schedules? The answer lies in an automated security framework that is integrated into the development lifecycle. Such a framework provides real-time feedback to development teams, enabling them to remediate vulnerabilities before they reach production.

Bio: I started my professional career developing in beautiful languages like Pascal and C. Later on I hopped on the Java train and stayed true to that ecosystem for many years. A couple of years ago I decided to move to the Information Security domain. I am currently working as a Security Specialist within the Dutch Government. I am part of an Incident Response team and -among other things- responsible for developing and maintaining the forensic capabilities of the team.

Program:

18:00 Doors open 

18:15 Dinner - Buffet

19:00 Session starts

21:00 We end the session

This meetup is hosted by:
results.name: Vulnerability Scanning in the Software Development Life Cycle

results.description:
Let's talk Front-end!

We are inviting all passionate Developers to come and join us at our Conference Center in Rijswijk for our TechTalk. More information will follow, we will keep you updated! Food, drinks & beer included :-)))

*** PROGRAM ***

Speaker: Bjørn Wikkeling
Subject: Natural JavaScript

This live demo will look at how to mimic natural processes in JavaScript. Think of animations that take gravity and other influences, artificial intelligence and objects that reproduce themselves into account and thereby pass on certain characteristics to the next generation, similar as DNA in real life. 

---

Speakers: Charmaine Niehoff & Kim Massaro
Subject: CodePamoja

CodePamoja is a not-for-profit initiative to give young graduates in the Netherlands and Kenya work experience developing software to an international standard.

---

Speaker: Tiety Kooistra 

Subject: Modular javascript architecture with angular and redux

How to make apps on top of a huge pile of diverse public data? At the municipality of Amsterdam we started building small reusable angular modules that can be used as needed mixed and matched to make several apps. This way you can access a segment of the data in the most comprehensible way. But there is more, each url needs be unique for every state of each app. This is were Redux comes in. Redux facilitates an easy way to handle all state related issues in one place.
results.name: Let's meet up and talk Front-end!!!

results.description:
Border Labs and ESA organise their second European Space Farm Collective lab session. Following the engaging Border Sessions event in The Hague in July, two projects will be on the ‘menu’:

• Recipes for Space Challenge: what our future astronauts will cook in 2020;

• Plant Characterisation Kit: Ph of the soil, CO2, sunlight, nutrients, and other factors determine how different plants grow. Work on developing a DIY citizen science kit to educate the next generation plant experts.

• Design the Space Farm Lab. Sketching the outline and purpose of a Space Farm Lab, an addition to existing fab labs or hubs focused on urban food solutions and technologies.

Next to these projects there will be plenty of time during the session to talk about the overall development of the Space Farming Collective in the upcoming months.

Limited places available, so please register early!
results.name: Lab Session #2  - A DIY Citizen Science Kit and Recipes for Space challenge

results.description:
Snel releasen is belangrijk bij software. Maar om het software ontwikkelproces te versnellen, moet je eerst vaststellen waar de knelpunten zitten. Een methode om knelpunten in kaart te brengen is Value Stream Mapping. Deze methodiek is erop gericht om alle betrokkenen rondom een proces bij elkaar te krijgen, kennis en ervaringen te delen en knelpunten te identificeren en op te lossen. Tijdens de Scrum Round Table op 15 september bespreken we hoe je het ontwikkelproces kunt optimaliseren door knelpunten te identificeren en weg te nemen. We doen dit door het spelen van een Scrum game rondom dit thema, gevolgd door discussie en het delen van ervaringen van de deelnemers hiermee de praktijk.

Over Scrum Round Tables
Scrum Round Tables zijn interactieve sessies die gericht zijn op het delen van praktijkervaringen met scrum. Iedere round table heeft een specifiek thema waarover in een interactieve setting gediscussieerd wordt. Meestal staat er ook een Scrum game rond het thema van de sessie op het programma.

Kijk hier voor meer informatie en om aan te melden: http://www.delta-n.nl/scrum-round-table-7
results.name: Scrum Round Table

results.description:
Dear Data Lovers,

Our very first Data Science MeetUp is planned! I am happy to announce that we will have a talk from Natalino Busa, head of Applied Data Science at Teradata, and a very enthusiastic data lover. From his bio:

All-round CTO, IT Architect, Data Scientist, and Digital Innovator with 15+ years experience in development, management and research of distributed architectures and scalable services and applications.

Here is a description of what he will show during his talk: 

Geolocated clustering and predictive services with Python and Scikit-Learn

Machine learning, and in particular clustering algorithms, can be used to determine which geographical areas are commonly visited and “checked into” by a given user and which areas are not. Such geographical analyses enable a wide range of services, from location-based recommenders to advanced security systems, and in general provide a more personalized user experience.

I will use these techniques to provide two flavours of predicting analytics:

First, I will build a simple recommender system which will provide the most trending venues in a given area. In particular, k-means tclustering can be applied to the dataset of geolocated events to partition the map into regions. For each region, we can rank the venues which are most visited. With this information, we can recommend venues and landmarks such as Times Square or the Empire State Building depending of the location of the user.

Second, I’ll determine geographical areas that are specific and personal to each user. In particular, I will use a density-based clustering technique such as DBSCAN to extract the areas where a user usually go. This analysis can be used to determine if a given data point is an outlier with respect to the areas where a user normally checks in. And therefore it can be used to score a "novelty" or "anomaly" factor given the location of a given event

We will analyze this events from a public dataset shared by Gowalla on venues checkins registered between 2008 and 2010. This notebook will cover some typical data science steps:

data acquisitiondata preparationdata exploration
Thereafter, we will dive into some unsupervised learning techniques: k-means and dbscan clustering, respectively for recommending popular venues and for determining outliers. 
For the remainder of the evening I was thinking of doing several informal lightning talks of various audience members. where anyone (you?) can talk about anything for 2 to 15 mins on something you are currently working on, share some valuable experience or ask the crowd for their insight in some problems you are facing. If you already know something you would like to present feel free to contact me.

Of course all this will be done while enjoying a cold beer and some good food, what's not to love? Hope to see you guys there!
results.name: Data Science Session

10:00 - 11:00 koffie/thee, je eigen verhaal delen en die van anderen horen en kijken waar er toevalligheden liggen

--------------------------

Hij bedacht een briljant plan om autochtone en allochtone kinderen met elkaar in contact te brengen en zat met dit idee bij de laatste drie kandidaten voor de DDD award. 

Zij is een stichting aan het oprichten vanuit idealisme. En wat maak je dan allemaal mee. 

Hij heeft de schetsen klaar voor zijn eerste grote fashion project: 15 jurken, een animatiefilm en een artbook. Nu de stap van schets realisatie. 

Zijn zijn mijn gasten op woensdag 5 oktober om 9:30 uur in het Ondernemerscafé bij de: Inspiring Entrepreneurs.

results.description:
Talk: "Scala, Go, Pony - what will you use to build or extend your (next) backend?"


Program:

18:00 Doors open - Dinner-Buffet

19:00 - 19:45 session 1

20:00- 20:45 session 2

21:00 We end the session

Speakers: 

Maarten Koopmans: "Maarten Koopmans holds a MSc in computational physics and after a decade working for ING, Surfnet and the Dutch government started his own company. In stead of saying much we point you to his LinkedIn profile <a></a>https://nl.linkedin.com/in/maartenkoopmans where you can read about him and his 8y old consultancy company. Besides being a husband and a father of three teenagers he has a passion for distributed systems and language design and communication.

Be sure to check out the interview "How to eat an elephant" on http://www.collaborationsuperpowers.com/hire-right-people-remote-working-maarten-koopmans/ which will be part of chapters 2 and 3 of the upcoming book ‘Collaboration Superpowers’ - and come enjoy the evening!"

Markus Fix: "I’m a true programmer at heart, constantly thinking about building reliable software systems that solve real-world problems. I construct the infrastructure that enables new services. Controlling software quality is key. I’ve 35 years of experience in doing this well. My current expertise is designing provably correct distributed messaging systems for big data.

I’m only looking to work with culturally mature software companies doing continuous integration and delivery. I’m only considering opportunities with teams that understand the challenges presented by distributed systems.

I’m looking to meet like-minded people with a shared purpose. People who share my desire to build mission-critical systems and connected utilities and bringing them to the cloud. Fellow pioneers in charge of our own digital destiny, that understand things have to be affordable, secure, and reliable, constantly aware of who has ownership of big data."

Drinks and location provided by:
results.name: Scala, Go, Pony - what will you use to build or extend your (next) backend?

results.description:
Continuous Integration en Continuous Delivery zijn hot topics waar wij op de werkvloer bij onze klanten regelmatig mee te maken hebben. Hierdoor hebben we ruime ervaring opgebouwd bij het automatiseren van deployments van applicaties. Wat is er nodig om succesvol stappen te zetten richting Continuous Delivery? Tijdens dit seminar gaan we in op wat er nodig is, organisatorisch, qua processen en qua tools. Daarnaast is er een keynote vanuit Microsoft en een praktijkcase door één van onze klanten.

Ga voor het volledige programma en om aan te melden naar: http://www.delta-n.nl/continuous-delivery-seminar

results.description:
== Excerpt ==

Clojure is a powerful functional programming language that can run on any Java, .NET or Javascript environment. Learn how to apply functional paradigms to the web, share code between client and server, have no-redeploy development cycles and much more, all with a lispy sauce. 

Speaker/trainer: Carlo Sciolla https://nl.linkedin.com/in/carlosciolla

Participants are required to have the following prerequisites:

== Hardware ==

bring your laptop! (or be prepared to pair-program)

== Software ==

any terminal shell you feel familiar with (bash / zsh / powershell)- working installations of leiningen and git- (optional) an editor / IDE of choice (emacs, atom, vim, intellij, eclipse they all have some support for editing Clojure)

== Brainware ==

no clojure background required- good command of at least one programming language- general understanding of functional programming concepts- experience with programming backend applications for the web

Program:

19:00 We start the workshop

21:00 We end the session

Op woensdag 7 december 2016 de eerste Inspiring Entrepreneurs - open coffee van het nieuwe seizoen. Met groot genoegen heb ik voor 12 nieuwe bijeenkomsten bijgetekend en ik kijk er enorm naar uit. In de Werkfabriek van Ian Smeyers hebben we een geweldige locatie partner voor onze maandelijkse bijeenkomsten gevonden. 

9:00 uur deur open en koffie/thee

9:25-9:30 de gelegenheid voor 10 ondernemers om 30 seconden te pitchen

9:30-10:00 Inspiring Entrepreneurs

10:00-11:00 uur koffie/thee vervolg

Met op 7 december de volgende Inspiring Entrepreneurs op het podium:

1. onze gastheer Ian Smeyers; sociaal ondernemer in hart en nieren. We zijn benieuwd waar komt dat sociale hart vandaan en hoe combineer je dat met geld verdienen?

2. Linda Rooij; grafisch ontwerpster en een trouwe bezoekster van onze maandelijkse bijeenkomsten en vertelde aan het Haags Stadsjournaal dat de bijeenkomsten door zouden moeten blijven gaan. Wie is deze trouwe bezoekster?

3. Onno Boks, ICT consultant en het eerste premium lid van oc070. Wat haalt hij hier elke maand en wat doet hij daar de rest van de maand mee? Hij gaat het ons vertellen. 

Tot 7 december, 

vriendelijke groet,

Tom

-------------------------------

De werkwijze voor het nieuwe seizoen:

• we hebben elke maand plek voor 50 mensen;

• aanmelden via de meetup pagina verplicht;

• premium leden hebben voorrang bij aanmelden voor de bijeenkomst;

• afmelden kan tot 24 uur van te voren;

• wel aangemeld niet gekomen? Dan brengen we € 10,- in rekening.
results.name: Inspiring Entrepreneurs - open coffee

results.description:
Program: 

18:00 Doors open - Dinner-Buffet

19:00 We start

21:00 We end the session

Speakers: Jeroen van den Bos & Gertjan Al

About the talk: Modern techniques such as domain-specific languages and declarative programming are easily integrated into a regular Java environment. As an example of such an approach, we present Metal, an open source Java library that implements a declarative DSL to specify parsers for binary data structures and file formats. In this talk we will show how to use Metal and demonstrate an alternative approach to building powerful and extensible libraries. 

After the talk we will have a hands-on session for those who would like experiment them selfs. (Then do not forget to bring your laptop)

Bio: Jeroen van den Bos is a senior researcher in the forensic software engineering-group at the Netherlands Forensic Institute. His work focuses on improving digital forensics software, which handles massive data sets but needs to constantly evolve to support new traces. He is interested in model-driven engineering, analysis and optimization techniques and functional programming.

Bio: Gertjan Al is a software engineer working at the NCIM group, with a focus on Java and web development. He is interested in improving automated processes and is currently working at the Netherlands Forensic Institute where he works on a big data platform and investigates data structures to find forensic traces.

Drinks and location provided by:
results.name: Metal: A Declarative Description Language for Binary Data in Java

results.description:
De term DevOps wordt steeds vaker gebruikt. Wat is nu DevOps en hoe kun je het gebruiken in je huidige Scrum organisatie. Wat zijn de overeenkomsten en wat zijn de verschillen? Waar moet je beginnen en waar loop je tegenaan?
Allemaal vragen, die we gezamenlijk proberen te beantwoorden tijdens de Round table sessie van 8 december.

Over Scrum Round Tables
Scrum Round Tables zijn interactieve sessies die gericht zijn op het delen van praktijkervaringen met scrum. Iedere round table heeft een specifiek thema waarover in een interactieve setting gediscussieerd wordt. Meestal staat er ook een Scrum game rond het thema van de sessie op het programma.

Kijk hier voor meer informatie en om aan te melden:

http://www.delta-n.nl/scrum-round-table-devops-in-scrum

results.name: Competa's December Tech Talk

venue.name: East West House/ בית מזרח מערב

results.description:
Do you dream about building food’s next frontiers? We're not talking about the next health shake, but something much, much bigger. Eating, with blockchain? Plants that can talk, grown with a food computer to suit your personal needs? Plants for medicines? A master plan for international and galactic vertical farming?

Ever imagine yourself on a mission to Mars and are asked what 10 kinds of plants you will have to eat for the rest of your life? Are you a chef who could build a ten-course meal for an international space station full of hungry astronauts?

If any of these futuristic ideas sound like fantasy, then we want YOU! Meet us at the first Mars Farm workshop and event December 14 in Tel Aviv-Jaffa. 

flux, AI for plants, will co-host with the event with international guests from Border Labs (Holland), MELiSSA (Holland), and the Mars Farm Odyssey, where together we will build 4 challenges:

1. Plants talk, we listen. This workshop works to understand the 6th+ senses of plants, and builds a new international standard language and consortium for Earth to Machine learning

2. New models for practical vertical farming in any city on earth, the moon and Mars

3. Blockchain, food, farms and space. How will distributed agriculture benefit space agronomy?

4. Chef’s challenge -- kicks off international contest to build the ultimate menu for space-bound tastebuds and realities.

Space is limited to 15 per challenge so sign up now. Workshop above led by 4 futurists will be from 4 to 6, with a break until 7PM. Signing up automatically includes you in the conference after at 7PM. 

SIGN UP HERE <<<<<<<------JUST JOINING THIS MEETUP PAGE WILL NOT GUARANTEE YOU A SPACE. REGISTER FOR YOUR SESSION >>>>>

Details below:

1. PLANTS PHONE HOME

led by Amichai Yifrach, Blake Burris and Christel Paille (through Skype)

We yearn to speak with extra-terrestrials, but there is already a universe of languages spoken by plants and our natural world. If we intend on farming more sustainably on earth, we have to get serious about learning this language so we can grow plants in-sync with our needs and theirs.

This workshop is led by Amichai Yifrach, military man and white hat hacker, who is the co-founder and CTO of flux (www.fluxiot.com). He is building Eddy, hardware and software listening to the 6th and nth senses of plants and environmental data. The device has practical implications for home growing on hydroponics in consumer and commercial applications and is perfect for gleaning grow wisdom for space farmers.

In this workshop, we will be looking into the flux approach and building an international standard for collecting environmental data, and extend this to the NGO world with MELiSSA, the citizen science project called ‘The Plant Characters’. This project aims to develop an open source hydroponics kit to monitor plant growth under controlled conditions. Scientific output is used by the MELiSSA consortium in their quest to develop technologies and systems for a ‘Micro-Ecological Life Support System Alternative’ (MELiSSA). The kit itself will be useful to hydroponics growers to optimize plant growth and conduct experiments.

Participants in this workshop will work on the design of the kit (what sensors and data will be needed), citizen-science strategy, and at the same time develop open ‘sensing’ standards for Tara, a new standard for environmental data. 

SIGN UP HERE

#2 THE LAUNCHPAD FOR URBAN FARMING ON EARTH AND ON MARS

led by Lavi Kushelevich

Lavi is a well-known urban farmer and consultant in Israel, who is involved in numerous ventures and projects with a social impact (e.g. educational projects, refugee projects). He believes that the technology to make cities highly self-sufficient is there already; the biggest obstacle is institutional. To enable a more rapid integration of urban farming practices he is developing a framework and implementation model focused on building urban farming infrastructures in cities across the world. This model can extend to the moon and Mars. 

In this session, you will learn about this framework and help develop it. Participants will be asked to commit themselves to prepare a proposition to introduce an urban farming solution in their own town. Your chance to lead the way. 

SIGN UP HERE

#3 BUILDING THE INTERNET OF URBAN FARMING

led by Matan Field

Matan Field is the founder and CEO of Backfeed, a blockchain based collaboration solution. He previously founded La’Zooz, a decentralized collaborative transportation system in Israel. Coming from the field of Physics research, Matan has grown to develop innovative open-source solutions based on principles of decentralization and technologies like cryptocurrency and blockchain to maintain trust and provide incentives for social and appropriate participation in evolving technologies and businesses. 

During this workshop, participants will use these far-out and futuristic concepts to come up with a vision for a future distributed urban farming infrastructure. Make headlines with us! 

SIGN UP HERE

#4: RECIPES FOR SPACE

led by Oren Ravid

You are chosen to lead the first mission to Mars. You and your crew have to decide what to bring, and most importantly, how to survive. You and your crew includes a chef, a farmer, a nutritionist, an engineer: what will you eat? What and how will you cook it?

Choose your ingredients and make a ‘recipe for space’. Make sure it’s tasty. And nutritious… Will you live getting to Mars right? What about alcohol or chocolate? What about the psychological effects of eating certain foods. And your physical health: plants as medicines? Think about the ingredients, and the plants and herbs that produce these ingredients: they need space and time to grow. Participants in this group will develop innovative solutions to feeding our future astronauts.

‘Recipes for Space’ will result in an improved framework for this challenge, before launching this competition aimed at top-chefs across the globe. An initial attempt to formalize this concept has been done in London, see notes about this workshop in this Google Docs.

SIGN UP HERE

6-7 BREAK

Bring something vegetarian to share. There will also be soup.

7-10 Presentations and networking

Between 7 and 9 we will have a rapid-fire conference (no PPT presentations) where you will meet and hear from our future's thought-leaders on sustainable food.

This is followed by a recap of the outcomes of the afternoon workshops, and several other inspiring people. There will be plenty of time to network and a list of attendees will be made available before the event.

SIGN UP HERE

10 to ?: Local restaurants and bars

The best conversations transcend time and Space!  So after 10 we’ll leave the East West House to explore the local nightlife in Jaffa.

Any questions or want to know about speaking/sponsorship opportunities? Contact your event hosts or email karin@fluxiot.com phone: 0543187449
results.name: Lab Session #3 - Space and Urban Farmers Tel Aviv (Workshop + Meetup)

results.description:
Op zaterdag 17 december 2016 van 15.00 uur tot 22.00 uur wordt er in Rotterdam een openSUSE installparty gehouden! Dit omdat de nieuwste versie van openSUSE het licht heeft gezien, openSUSE 42.2 Leap. Altijd al eens kennis willen maken met Linux en dit geval openSUSE in het bijzonder. Nu is er een leuke manier om dat eens te doen. Aan de hand van deskundige sprekers wordt een rondleiding gegeven door de nieuwste versie van de linux distributie openSUSE 42.2 Leap. Ook zijn er naast deze rondleiding ook introducties van gebruikers toepassingen, gebaseerd op Linux in het bijzonder maar ook vaak bruikbaar onder andere PC besturingsystemen.

Programma:
15:00 - Welkom

15:15 - 15:45 Intro openSUSE en 25 jaar Linux door Gertjan Lettink ( Knurpht)

15:45 - 16:15 Live installatie Leap 42.2,

16:15 - 16:45 openSUSE op klein hardware (Raspberry oid.) door Gábor Nyers

16:45 – 17:15 Installatie of live openSUSE uitproberen op laptop of PC

17:15 - 18:00 Niet ingevuld, uitlooptijd bovenstaande en informeel praatjes

18:00 - Eten 19:00 - Vrij spelen / Workshops / installatie / Mocht je zelf nog een leuke workshop willen verzorgen, dan kan dat . Geef het dan wel even door.

• Workshop installatie openSUSE op de Raspberry Pi (neem een micro SD kaart van min. 4GB mee)

22:00 - Einde

Waar:
Gebouw "De Waerschut" Van Waerschutstraat 11
3033 TL Rotterdam
results.name: openSUSE Leap 42.2 introductie- en installparty
